H0.text: An 18th century innovation what is the method of gilding furniture and clocks known as. Vermeil

H1.text: An 18th century innovation what is the method of gilding furniture and clocks known as. Electroplating

H2.text: An 18th century innovation what is the method of gilding furniture and clocks known as. Fire Gilding

H3.text: An 18th century innovation what is the method of gilding furniture and clocks known as. Ormolu

A4.text: The manufacture of true ormolu employs a process known as mercury-gilding or fire-gilding, in which a solution of mercuric nitrate is applied to a piece of copper, brass, or bronze, followed by the application of an amalgam of gold and mercury.

A5.text: The process has generally been supplanted by the electroplating of gold over a nickel substrate, which is more economical and less dangerous.
